description: TO ELECT A SPEAKER OF THE HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES. SAM RAYBURN (D) OPPOSES JOE MARTIN (R); SAUTHOFF (4) AND HULL (3) EACH RECEIVED 1 VOTE.
Issue1: Election of the Speaker of the House

description: TO AMEND H.R. 1648, APPROPRIATIONS FOR TREASURY & POST OFFICE DEPT. BY PROVIDING THAT NO PART OF THE MONEY APPROPRIATED UNDER H.R. 1648 BE SPENT FOR COLLECT- ING, SORTING, TRANSPORTING OR DELIVERING FREE THE MAIL OF ANY OFFICER IN ANY EXECUTIVE DEPARTMENT OR ADMINISTRATIVE AGENCY OF THE GOVERNMENT.

TO AMEND H.R. 1648, APPROPRIATIONS FOR TREASURY AND POST OFFICE DEPTS, BY PROVIDING THAT NO PART OF ANY APPROPRIATION IN H.R. 164, IS TO BE USED TO PAY THE SALARY OF WILLIAM PICKENS, A PROMOTION SPECIALIST IN THE TREASURY DEPT., BECAUSE OF HIS ALLEGED COMMUNISTIC SYMPATHIES AND ACTIVITIES.
TO PASS H.RES. 65, AUTHORIZING THE CONTINUATION OF THE SPECIAL COMMITTEE TO INVESTIGATE UN-AMERICAN ACTIVITIES.
TO PASS H.RES. 102 AUTHORIZING THE FORMATION OF A SPECIAL 7 MEMBER COMMITTEE TO INVESTIGATE CERTAIN ACTS OF EXECUTIVE AGENCIES.

TO AMEND H.R. 1762, APPROPRIATIONS FOR EXECUTIVE OFFICE & SUNDRY INDEPENDENT OFFICES, BY CUTTING THE APPROPRIATION OF THE HOME OWNERS' LOAN CORPORATION BY APPROXIMATELY 33% WITH THE INTENT THAT THE CORPORATION BEGIN TO LIQUIDATE ITSELF IN PREPARATION FOR ITS EVENTUAL CLOSING.
TO PASS H.RES. 124, AUTHORIZING AN APPROPRIATION NOT TO EXCEED $75,000 FOR THE ACTIVITIES OF THE HOUSE UN- AMERICAN ACTIVITIES COMMITTEE.
TO PASS H.R. 1692 AUTHORIZING AN APPROPRIATION OF APPROXI- MATELY $1.25 BILLION FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF VARIOUS FACILITIES BY THE NAVY.
TO AMEND H.RES. 23, A RESOLUTION ESTABLISHING A COMMITTEE ON AVIATION, BY ELIMINATING FROM THE SCOPE OF THE AUTHORITY TO DEAL WITH ANY TYPES OF AVIATION SAVE CIVIL AND COMMERCIAL.
TO PASS H. RES. 23, AUTHORIZING THE ESTABLISHMENT OF A HOUSE COMMITTEE ON AVIATION.
TO PASS H.R. 2068, A BILL TO APPROPRIATE AN ADDITIONAL $4 BILLION, AND TO ALLOW FURTHER CONTRACTUAL OBLIGATIONS OF $460 MILLION FOR THE NAVY FOR THE REMAINDER OF FISCAL YR. 1943.
TO PASS H.R. 1501, A BILL TO EXTEND THE LEND-LEASE ACT FOR ONE YEAR.
TO PASS H.R. 1780, AS AMENDED, A BILL TO RAISE THE DEBT LIMIT FROM $125 BILLION TO $210 BILLION, AND TO REVOKE PORTIONS OF THE WAGE FREEZE ORDERED BY THE PRESIDENT.
TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS H.R. 1366, A BILL TO PROVIDE TEMPORARY ADDITIONAL COMPENSATION FOR POSTAL EMPLOYEES.

CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 1780, PROVIDING AN INCREASE IN PUBLIC DEBT LIMIT.  THE CONFERENCE REPORT CHANGES THE HOUSE VERSION OF H.R. 1780 BY SUBSTITUTING FOR THE DISNEY AMENDMENT, REVOKING PORTIONS OF THE PRESIDENTIAL WAGE FREEZE, AN AMENDMENT WHICH IN EFFECT, FREEZES SALARIES AT THEIR HIGHEST RATE FROM JAN. 1 TO SEPT. 15, 1942.
TO AMEND H.R. 2218, INDIVIDUAL INCOME TAX COLLECTION BILL, BY FORGIVING INCOME TAXES FOR 1942, WITH THE EXCEPTION OF THOSE ALREADY PAID, IN ORDER TO MAKE TAXPAYERS CURRENT.
TO RECOMMIT H.R. 2218, THE INDIVIDUAL INCOME TAX COLLECTION BILL TO THE WAYS AND MEANS COMMITTEE, WITHOUT INSTRUCTIONS.
TO AMEND H.R. 2087, THE WAR SECUIRTY ACT, BY MAKING FAILURE TO REPORT KNOWLEDGE OF ACTS COMMITTED AGAINST THE U.S. GOVERNMENT, (EG. SABOTAGE) A CRIME PUNISHABLE BY UP TO 10 YEARS IN PRISON.
TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS H.R. 1860, A BILL SETTING OVERTIME PAY RATES FOR CERTAIN EMPLOYEES IN THE WAR AND NAVY DEPARTMENTS.

TO AMEND H.R. 2397, STATE, JUSTICE AND COMMERCE DEPTS. APPROPRIATION BILL, 1944 BY REDUCING FROM $4.5 MILLION TO $3 MILLION THE APPROPRIA- TION FOR COOPERATIVE WAR EFFORTS BETWEEN THE U.S. AND THE OTHER AMERICAN REPUBLICS

TO AMEND H.R. 2397, STATE, JUSTICE AND COMMERCE DEPTS. APPROPRIATION BILL, BY PROVIDING THAT NO PART OF THE APPROPRIATIONS OF H.R. 2397 BE USED TO FURTHER OR PROMOTE THE USAGE OF SUBSTITUTE DAIRY PRODUCTS.
TO AMEND H.R. 2409 LEGISLATIVE AND JUDICIARY DEPTS. APPROPRIATION BILL, BY APPROPRIATING $100,000 FOR PRE- LIMINARY WORK IN CONNECTION WITH THE PREPARATION OF A NEW EDITION OF THE UNITED STATES CODE.
TO PASS H.R. 653, A BILL TO MAKE EXTORTION AND ROBBERY IN INTERSTATE COMMERCE UNLAWFUL.
TO AMEND H.R. 2481, DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE APPROPRIATIONS BY BARRING ANY APPROPRIATIONS FOR INCENTIVE PAYMENTS OR SUB- SIDIES, ESPECIALLY FOR AGRICULTURE.

TO AGREE TO THE CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 1860, WAR OVERTIME PAY ACT.  ESSENTIALLY, THE SENATE VERSION EXTENDS THE OVERTIME PAY FEATURES OF THE BILL TO A NUMBER OF FEDERAL EMPLOYEES NOT COVERED ON THE ORIGINAL HOUSE BILL, AND EXTENDS WAGE INCREASES TO EMPLOYEES EARNING, AT PRESENT, OVER $5,000 A YEAR.

TO AMEND H.R. 2570, THE CURRENT TAX PAYMENT BILL, BY MAKING ALL TAXPAYERS CURRENT, AND FORGIVING APPROXIMATELY $8 BILLION IN INCOME TAXES.  THE ORIGINAL COMMITTEE BILL BILL FORGIVES ABOUT $4.7 BILLION IN TAXES OR ABOUT 7 MILLION TAXPAYERS, AND PROVIDES, THEREFORE, THAT THE REMAINDER OF TAXPAYERS (C. 37  MILLION) MAKE A DOUBLE TAX PAYMENT FOR 1942-43.

TO RECOMMIT H.R. 2570 AND TO INSTRUCT THE WAYS & MEANS COMMITTEE TO REPORT THE BILL BACK WITH THE ROBERTSON-FORAND BILL AS A SUBSTITUTE.  THE ROBERTSON-FORAND PROPOSAL FOR- GIVES APPROXIMATELY $7.6 BILLION IN INCOME TAXES FOR 1942 AND INCLUDES ALL TAX PAYERS IN THE FIRST TAXABLE INCOME BRACKET AND THE FIRST SURTAX INCOME BRACKET.
TO PASS H.R. 2570, AS AMENDED.
TO TABLE THE MOTION TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE WHEREBY THE CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 1860 WAS NOT AGREED TO.
TO AGREE TO THE CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 1860.

CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 1648, TREASURY AND POST OFFICE APPROPRIATIONS, TO RECED AND CONCUR WITH SENATE AMEND- MENT NO. 1, WHICH STRIKES THE PROHIBITION AGAINST USING FUNDS APPROPRIATED IN H.R 1648 FOR PURCHASE OF SILVER.
CONFERENCE REPORT :  TO RECEDE AND CONCUR IN SENATE AMENDMENT NO. 2 TO HR. 1648, WHICH INCREASES THE APPROPRI- ATION FOR FOREIGN FUND CONTROL FROM $3.1 TO $3.8 MILLION.
CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 1648:  TO INSIST UPON DISAGREE- MENT TO SENATE AMENDMENTS NOS. 17, 18, AND 26, ALL RELATING TO POST OFFICE APPROPRIATIONS.

TO PASS H.J.RES. 111, A BILL TO EXTEND THE RECIPROCAL TRADE AGREEMENTS ACT.  ALSO, H.J. RES. 111 LIMITS PRESIDENT- IAL AUTHORITY BY PROVIDING THAT NO PRESIDENTIAL PRO- CLAMATION MAY INCREASE OR DECREASE ANY DUTY BY MORE THAN 50% OR TRANSFER ANY ARTICLE BETWEEN THE DUTIABLE AND FREE LISTS.

CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 2570, THE CURRENT TAX PAYMENT BILL: TO INSTRUCT THE HOUSE MANGAGERS TO AGREE TO A SENATE AMENDMENT WHICH SUBSTITUTES THE CARLSON PLAN, PREVIOUSLY DEFEATED BY THE HOUSE, FOR THE ROBERTSON-FORAND PLAN, WHICH WAS THE VERSION WHICH PASSED THE HOUSE.

TO AMEND H.R. 2714, BY PROHIBITING FURTHER SALARY OR PERSONAL SERVICE APPROPRIATIONS FOR THREE GOVERNMENT OFFICIALS, GOODWIN B. WATSON, WILLIAM E. DODD, JR., & ROBERT MORSE LOVETT, FOR ALLEGED SUBVERSIVE ACTIVITIES.
TO PASS H.R. 2713, NAVY APPROPRIATIONS BILL, 1944.
TO AMEND H.R. 2753, A BILL MAKING SUPPLEMENTAL LEND- LEASE APPROPRIATIONS, BY PROVIDING THAT NO PART OF THE APPROPRIATION IN H.R. 2753 BE USED FOR THE PAYMENT OF ANY SUBSIDY ON AGRICULTURAL PRODUCTS.
TO PASS H.R. 2753, A BILL MAKING SUPPLEMENTAL LEND-LEASE APPROPRIATIONS.
TO DISCHARGE THE RULES COMMITTEE FROM FURTHER CONSIDERATION OF H.RES. 131, THE RULE FOR CONSIDERING H.R. 7, THE ANTI-POLL TAX BILL.
TO PASS H. RES. 131, THE RULE FOR CONSIDERING H.R. 7, THE ANTI-POLL TAX BILL.
TO PASS H.R. 7, A BILL TO MAKE UNLAWFUL THE REQUIREMENT FOR PAYMENT OF A POLL TAX AS A PREREQUISITE FOR VOTING IN A PRIMARY OR OTHER ELECTION OF NATIONAL OFFICE-HOLDERS.
TO PASS S. 495, A BILL TO ESTABLISH A WOMEN'S ARMY AUXILARY COPRS.

CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R 2570, THE CURRENT TAX PAYMENT BILL, TO RECEDE FROM DISAGREEMENT TO A SENATE AMENDMENT WITH AN AMENDMENT.  THE FINAL VERSION OF THE BILL IS A COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE CARLSON AND ROBERTSON- FORAND PROPOSALS.
TO PASS H. RES. 234, RULES FOR CONSIDERATION OF S. 796, A BILL CONCERNING USE AND OPERATION BY THE U.S. OF CERTAIN PLANTS IN THE INTEREST OF NATIONAL DEFENSE.

TO AMEND S. 796, A BILL CONCERNING THE USE AND OPERATION OF WAR PLANTS IN PROSECUTION OF THE WAR. THIS AMENDMENT OUTLINES THE PROCEDURES UNDER WHICH LABOR DISPUTES MUST BE CONDUCTED UNDER S. 796.  AMONG OTHER PROVISIONS, STRIKES ARE NOT SPECIFICALLY BANNED, AS OPPOSED TO THE ORIGINAL BILL, BUT THEY MAY ONLY TAKE PLACE AT A PLANT BEING RUN UNDER GOV'T. AUTHORITY FOR WAR PRODUCTION AFTER THE SECRETARY OF LABOR HAS CERTI- FIED THAT THE MAJORITY OF WORKERS, THRU A SECRET BALLOT, HAVE VOTED IN FAVOR OF A STRIKE.

TO PASS. S. 796, A BILL PROVIDING RULES FOR GOV'T OPERATION OF CERTAIN PLANTS, MINES, AND OTHER PROPERTIES IN THE PROSECUTION OF THE WAR, AND FOR PREVENTING STRIKES, LOCK-OUTS, AND STOPPAGES OF PRODUCTION.  IN ADDITION, IT SPECIFIES THE POWERS OF THE WAR LABOR BOARD TO DEAL WITH LABOR DISPUTES UNDER THE ACT.

CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 2714, URGENT DEFICIENCY APPROPRIATIONS BILL: TO AMEND H.R. 2714, TO PROVIDE THAT THE STATE DEPT. AND OFFICE OF STRATEGIC SERVICES ARE, IN ADDI- TION TO DEPTS. OF WAR AND NAVY, NOT TO BE INCLUDED IN THE PROHIBITION EXPRESSED IN A SENATE AMENDMENT, AGAINST ANY DEPARTMENT WHICH HAS ALREADY RECEIVED MONEY RECEIVING FURTHER FUNDS UNDER THIS BILL.
TO AGREE TO THE CONFERENCE REPORT ON S. 796, A BILL CONCERNING THE USE AND OPERATION OF WAR PLANTS IN PROSECUTION OF THE WAR.

CONFERENCE REPORT ON HR. 1648: TO RECEDE AND CONCUR IN SENATE AMENDMENT NO. 1 TO H.R. 1648 WITH AN AMENDMENT. SENATE AMENDMENT NO. 1 DELETES FROM H.R. 1648 THE HOUSE PROVISION PROHIBITING THE EXPENDITURE OF ANY APPROPRIATION IN THE BILL FOR CARRYING OUT THE PROVISION OF THE SILVER PURCHASE ACTS OF JUNE 19, 1934 & JULY 6, 1934.  THE HOUSE AMENDMENT RESTORES THE DELETED PROVISIONS TO THE BILL.

CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 1648, TREASURY AND POST OFFICE APPROPRIATIONS: TO FURTHER AMEND A SENATE AMENDMENT BY RESTORING A HOUSE-PASSED PROHIBITION AGAINST FREE POSTAL SERVICE FOR THE EXECUTIVE BRANCH.
TO AMEND H.R. 2968, APPROPRIATION FOR WAR AGENCIES, 1944, BY REDUCING THE APPROPRIATION FOR THE OPERATION OF THE OFFICE OF PRICE ADMINISTRATION FROM $165 MILLION TO $130 MILLION.

TO AMEND H.R. 2968, BY PROVIDING THAT NO PART OF THE APPROPRIATIONS IN H.R. 2968 BE USED TO PAY THE SALARY OF ANY OFFICIAL IN THE OFFICE OF PRICE ADMINISTRATION WHOSE JOB IT IS TO SET PRICES IN AN INDUSTRY IF THAT OFFICIAL HAS NOT HAD AT LEAST FIVE YEARS OF BUSINESS EXPERIENCE IN THAT INDUSTRY.

TO AMEND H.R. 2968, BY PROVIDING THAT NO PART OF THE APPROPRIATION FOR THE OFFICE OF PRICE ADMINISTRATION BE MADE AVAILABLE FOR PRICE CONTROL OVER ANY FOOD COMMODITY WHICH HAS NOT YET REACHED PARITY, NOR FOR PRICE CONTROL OVER ANY COMMODITY WHICH IS NOT A NECESSITY.

TO AMEND H.R. 2968, BY REDUCING THE APPROPRIATION FOR THE OFFICE OF WAR INFORMATION FROM APPROXIMATELY $34.5 MILLION TO ABOUT $28.9 MILLION.  IT ALSO PROVIDES THAT NO PART OF SUCH FUNDS IS TO BE ALLOCATED TO THE DOMESTIC OPERATIONS BRANCH OF THE OFFICE OF WAR INFORMATION.
TO PASS H.R. 2996, A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE MIL- ITARY ESTABLISHMENT, 1944.

CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 2409: A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR LEGISLATIVE AND JUDICIARY BRANCH, TO RECEDE AND CONCUR IN A SENATE AMENDMENT PROVIDE $100,000 FOR PREPARATION OF A NEW EDITION OF THE U.S. CODE.
CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 2481, DEPT OF AGRICULTURE APPROPRIATIONS BILL, 1944: TO RECEDE AND CONCUR IN A SENATE AMENDMENT INCREASING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE AGRICULTURAL ADJUSTMENT ADMINISTRATION.

CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 2481: TO RECEDE AND CONCUR IN A SENATE AMENDMENT PROVIDING THAT THE APPROPRIATIONS TO AGRICULTURAL ADJUSTMENT ADMINISTRATION MAY BE USED ONLY FOR PAYMENTS FOR COMPLIANCE WITH SOIL-BUILDING AND WATER CONSTRUCTION MEASURES.

CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R 2481, TO RECEDE AND CONCUR IN SENATE AMENDMENTS WHICH INCREASE APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE CROP INSURANCE PROGRAM AND DELETE THE HOUSE PROVISION THAT THE CROP INSURANCE PROGRAM MAY NOT EXTEND ITS COMMITMENTS.
CONFERENCE REPORT ON H. R. 2481, WHICH INCREASES THE APPROPRIATION FOR FUNDS TO BE LENT THRU THE R.F.C. AS PART OF THE RURAL ELECTRIFICATION PROGRAM.
TO OVERRIDE VETO OF S. 796, A BILL CONCERNING THE USE AND OPERATION OF WAR PLANTS FOR THE PROSECUTION OF THE WAR.

CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 2481, TO RECEDE AND CONCUR IN A SENATE AMENDMENT WHICH DELETES THE HOUSE PROVISION LIMITING APPROPRIATIONS TO THE AGRICULTURAL ADJUSTMENT ADMINISTRATION TO PAYMENTS FOR COMPLIANCE WITH SOIL-BUILDING AND WATER CONSERVATION PRACTICES.

CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 2481, TO RECEDE AND CONCUR IN A SENATE AMENDMENT WHICH STRIKES OUT A HOUSE PROHIBITION AGAINST INCENTIVE PAYMENTS TO FARMERS, AND TO FURTHER AMEND THE AMENDMENT BY PROVIDING THAT INCENTIVE PAYMENTS MAY NOT BE GIVEN FOR MAJOR CROPS.

CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 2714, URGENT DEFICIENCY APPROPRIATIONS, TO RECEDE AND CONCUR IN SENATE AMENDMENTS, ONE OF WHICH DELETES THE HOUSE PROHIBITION AGAINST PAYING SALARIES OF THREE FEDERAL EMPLOYEES WHO WERE SUSPECTED OF SUBVERSIVE ACTIVITIES.
CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 2481, TO RECEDE AND CONCUR IN SENATE AMENDMENTS WHICH PROVIDE FOR EXPANSION OF THE CROP TO RECEDE AND CONCUR IN INSURANCE PROGRAM.

CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 2935,  DEPT. OF LABOR, FEDERAL SECURITY APPROPRIATIONS, TO RECOMMIT H.R. 2935 TO CONFERENCE WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO CONCUR IN A SENATE AMENDMENT WHICH STRIKES FROM THE BILL A PROHIBITION AGAINST REGULATIONS DISCRIMINATING BETWEEN PERSONS PRACTICING OBSTETRICS.

CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R 2935, DEPT. OF LABOR, FEDERAL SECURITY APPROPRIATIONS, TO RECEDE AND CONCUR WITH A SENATE AMENDMENT APPROPRIATING $45 MILLION FOR THE NATIONAL YOUTH ADMINISTRATION, AND ALLOWING ALL YOUTHS BETWEEN AGES OF 16 AND 25 TO PARTICIPATE IN N.Y.A., RATHER THAN LIMITING THE PROGRAM TO "NEEDY" YOUTH.
CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 2719, INTERIOR DEPT. APPROPRIA- TIONS, 1944, TO RECEDE AND CONCUR ON A SENATE AMENDMENT WHICH INCREASES THE APPROPRIATION FOR THE BONNEVILLE DAM ADMINISTRATION.
TO SEND H.R. 2869, A BILL EXTENDING THE LIFE OF THE COMMODITY CREDIT CORPORATION, TO THE COMM. ON BANKING AND CURRENCY, TOGETHER WITH PRESIDENT ROOSEVELT'S VETO MESSAGE.
TO OVERRIDE VETO OF H.R. 2869, A BILL EXTENDING THE LIFE OF THE COMMODITY CREDIT CORPORATION.

CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 2968, WAR AGENCY APPROPRIATIONS, TO RECOMMIT TO CONFERENCE WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO DISAGREE WITH SENATE AMENDMENTS INCREASING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE OFFICE OF PRICE ADMINISTRATION, AND REMOVING CERTAIN RESTRICITIONS PLACED ON THE OPA BY THE HOUSE.

CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 2968, TO INSIST ON DISAGREEMENT TO A SENATE AMENDMENT PROVIDING THAT NO APPROPRIATION IN H.R. 2968 SHALL BE AVAILABLE FOR SALARIES OF PERSONS MAKING MORE THAN $4,500 A YEAR, WHO HAVE NOT BEEN APPOINTED WITH THE ADVICE AND CONSENT OF THE SENATE.
TO AGREE TO THE CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 3030, THE SECOND DEFICIENCY APPROPRIATIONS BILL, 1943, WHICH ALSO MAKES CERTAIN SUPPLEMENTAL APPROPRIATIONS.

CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 3030, SECOND DEFICIENCY APPROPRI- ATIONS, TO RECEDE AND CONCUR IN A SENATE AMENDMENT WHICH APPROPRIATES OVER $8 MILLION FOR THE COMPLETION OF CERTAIN AIRPORT PROJECTS BY THE W.P.A.

CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 2968, TO RECEDE AND CONCUR IN SENATE AMENDMENT PROVIDING THAT APPROPRIATIONS MADE IN H.R. 2968 MAY NOT PAY SALARIES OF PERSONS MAKING OVER $4,500 A YEAR, WHO HAVE NOT BEEN APPOINTED WITH ADVICE AND CONSENT OF THE SENATE.

CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 2968, TO RECEDE FROM DISAGREEMENT TO SENATE AMENDMENT NO. 33 AND TO CONCUR THERE- IN WITH AN AMENDMENT.  SENATE AMENDMENT NO.33 CONCERNS SENATE APPROVAL OR PRESIDENTIAL APPOINTMENTS TO POSITIONS OVER $4,500 PER YEAR.  THE HOUSE AMENDMENT RAISE THE SALARY LIMIT TO $5,500 TO REQUIRE SENATE APPROVAL, AND ALLOWS PERSONS APPOINTED BETWEEN JUNE 30, 1943 AND NOV. 1, 1943 TO HOLD OFFICE UNTIL THE LATTER DATE UNLESS THE SENATE, IN THE INTERIM REFUSES TO CONSENT TO THE APPOINTMENT.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS H.CON.RES. 25, BY WHICH CONGRESS EXPRESSES ITSELF AS FAVORING THE CREATION OF APPROPRIATE INTERNATIONAL MACHINERY WITH ADEQUATE POWER TO MAINTAIN PEACE, AND THAT CONGRESS FAVORS U.S. PARTICIPATION IN SUCH ORGANIZATION.
TO PASS H.J.RES. 15., A BILL WHICH APPROPRIATES ADDITIONAL FUNDS FOR MATERNITY AND INFANT CARE FOR SOLDIERS' WIVES.
TO PASS S. 1279, A BILL TO AMEND THE SERVICEMEN'S DEPENDENTS ALLOWANCE ACT BY LIBERALIZING FAMILY ALLOWANCES, AMONG OTHER THINGS.

TO RECOMMIT S.J.RES. 95, PROVIDING FOR THE CONTINUATION OF THE GOVERNMENT OF THE PHILIPPINES, TO THE COMMITTEE ON INSULAR AFFAIRS, WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO REVIEW THE PROBLEM IN FURTHER HEARINGS, AS REQUESTED BY THE OFFICIALS OF THE PHILIPPINE GOVT. NOW RESIDING IN WASHINGTON.
TO PASS S.J.RES. 95, PROVIDING FOR THE CONTINUATION OF THE GOVERNMENT OF THE PHILIPPINES.
TO PASS H.R. 3356, A BILL INCREASING MONTHLY RATES OF COMP- ENSATION OR PENSION PAYABLE TO DISABLED VETERANS FOR SERVICE-INCURRED DISABILITY AND TO WIDOWS AND CHILDREN.
TO PASS H.R. 3377, A BILL INCREASING THE RATE OF PENSION TO WORLD WAR WETERANS FROM .40 TO $50 PER MONTH.
TO PASS H.R. 3477, A BILL TO CONTINUE THE COMMODITY CREDIT CORPORATION.  H.R. 3477 FORBIDS FURTHER PAYMENT OF GENERAL CONSUMER SUBSIDIES OUT OF GOVERNMENT FUNDS.
TO PASS H.J.RES. 171, ALLOWING DUTY-FREE IMPORTATION FOR 90 DAYS, OF CERTAIN GRAINS AND OTHER PRODUCTS USED AS POULTRY AND LIVESTOCK FEED.
TO DISCHARGE THE COMMITTEE ON BANKING AND CURRENCY FROM FURTHER CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 2887, A BILL CONCERNING THE ADMINISTRATION OF PETROLEUM RESOURCES.
TO RECOMMIT H.R. 2887 TO THE COMMITTEE ON BANKING AND CURRENCY.
CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 3598, DEFICIENCY APPROPRIATION BILL, TO RECEDE AND CONCUR IN A SENATE AMENDMENT, WHICH RE-INSERTS AN APPROPRIATION TO W.P.A. FOR AIRPORT IMPROVEMENTS.
CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 3598, TO INSIST ON DISAGREEMENT TO A SENATE AMENDMENT APPROPRIATING ADDITIONAL MONEY FOR WA- TER CONSERVATION AND UTILITY PROJECTS.

CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 3598, TO INSIST ON DISAGREEMENT TO A SENATE AMENDMENT PROVIDING THAT WHEN FUNDS FOR A CERTAIN WAR OR NAVY DEPT. PROJECT ARE NOT NEEDED, THEY MAY NOT BE TRANSFERRED FOR USE ELSEWHERE WITHOUT CONGRESSIONAL APPROVAL.  SECOND, IT PROVIDES THAT THE BUREAU OF THE BUDGET MAY NOT IMPOUND FUNDS FROM ANY PROJECT WITHOUT CONGRESSIONAL CONSENT.  ALSO, IT PREVENTS ANY ADMINISTRA- TIVE AGENCY FROM PLACING PROJECT FUNDS IN A RESERVE, STATUS.
TO PASS S. 1543, A BILL PROVIDING THAT UPON DISCHARGE EACH MEMBER OF THE ARMED FORCES SHALL RECEIVE $100 - $300 "MUSTERING-OUT PAY" WITH CERTAIN EXCEPTIONS.

TO AMEND H.J.R. 192 PROVIDING FOR U.S. PARTICIPATION IN THE UNITED NATIONS RELIEF AND REHABILITATION AGENCY, BY PROVIDING THAT THE U.S. STATE DEPARTMENT RATHER THAN THE PRESIDENT, OR ANY OTHER EXECUTIVE AGENCY, SHALL ADMINISTER U.S. PARTICIPATION IN U.N.R.R.A.
TO RECOMMIT H.J.RES. 192, WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO LOWER THE MAXIMUM AMOUNT THAT MAY BE APPROPRIATED TO U.N.R.R.A. FROM $1.35 BILLION TO $700 MILLION.
TO PASS H.J. RES. 192.
TO AGREE TO CONFERENCE REPORT ON S. 1543, A BILL PROVIDING MUSTERING OUT PAY FOR CERTAIN ARMED SERVICE VETERANS.
TO ORDER THE PREVIOUS QUESTION ON H.RES. 412, AN OPEN RULE FOR CONSIDERATION OF S. 1285, THE SOLDIERS VOTING BILL.
TO RECOMMIT S. 1285, THE SOLDIERS VOTING BILL, WITH INSTRUC- TIONS TO SUBSTITUTE THE "WORLEY BILL", WHICH PROVIDES THAT A FEDERAL BALLOT BE AUTOMATICALLY ISSUED TO EACH SOLDIER SERVING OVERSEAS.

TO PASS S. 1285, SOLDIERS VOTING BILL, WHICH PROVIDES A METHOD BY WHICH MEMBERS OF THE ARMED FORCES SERVING OVERSEAS MAY AUTOMATICALLY RECEIVE A POST CARD APPLICATION FOR ABSENTEE BALLOTS FROM THEIR STATES 82 DAYS BEFORE THE ELECTION OF 1944.
TO AGREE TO CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 3687, THE REVENUE ACT OF 1943.

TO RECOMMIT H.R. 4133, TREASURY AND POST OFFICE APPROPRIATIONS BILL, 1945, WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO REDUCE APPROPRIATIONS TO THE BUREAU OF CUSTOMS, TREASURER'S OFFICE, AND BUREAU OF ENGRAVING AND PRINTING.
TO PASS H.R. 4133, TREASURY AND POST OFFICE APPROPRIATIONS, 1945.
TO PASS H.R. 2801, A BILL TO PROVIDE AN ADDITIONAL SECRETARY OF THE INTERIOR.

CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 3477, THE COMMODITY CREDIT CORPORATION, WHICH PROLONGS THE LIFE OF CERTAIN CCC PROGRAMS BEYOND THE TERMINATION SPECIFIED IN THE HOUSE-PASSED BILL, EXCLUDES CERTAIN ADDITIONAL AGRICULTURE PRODUCTS FROM RESTRICTIONS ON SUBSIDY PAYMENTS, AND PROVIDES THAT NOTHING IN THE BILL SHALL BE CONSTRUED TO PREVENT MAKING OF PARITY PAYMENTS.
TO OVERRIDE VETO OF H.R. 3477, EXTENDING LIFE OF THE COMMODITY CREDIT CORPORATION.
TO OVERRIDE VETO OF H.R. 3687, THE REVENUE ACT OF 1944.
TO PASS H.R. 2985, A BILL TO ALLOW GARNISHMENT OF WAGES AND SALARIES OF GOVERNMENT EMPLOYEES.
TO AMEND H.R. 4346, FIRST DEFICIENCY APPROPRIATION BILL, BY STRIKING A PARAGRAPH OVJECTED OBJECTED TO AS MAKING LEGISLATION IN AN APPROPRIATIONS.
TO RECOMMIT H.R. 4346 FIRST  DEFICIENCY APPROPRIATIONS BILL, WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO APPROPRIATE AN ADDITIONAL $7.5 MILLION FOR WAR HOUSING.
TO PASS H. RES. 166, AUTHORIZING AN INVESTIGATION OF CONDIDITIONS OF INDIANS WITH A VIEW TO ASCERTAIN WHETHER ADDITIONAL LEGISLATION IS NECESSARY.
TO AGREE TO CONFERENCE REPORT ON S. 1285, THE SOLDIERS VOTING BILL, WHICH, AS FINALLY PASSED, PROVIDES A FEDERAL BALLOT UNDER CERTAIN CONDITIONS.
TO AMEND H.R. 3961, THE RIVERS AND HARBOR BILL.  THE AMENDMENT CONCERNS THE TOMBIGBEE INLAND WATERWAYS.
TO AGREE TO CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.J.RES. 192, PROVIDING FOR U.S. PARTICIPATION IN THE U.N. RELIEF AND REHABILITATION AGENCY.

TO AMEND H.R. 4443, DEPT. OF AGRICULTURE APPROPRIATIONS, BY PROVIDING THAT NO FUNDS APPROPRIATED IN H.R. 4443 SHALL BE USED TO REIMBURSE ANY PERSON WHO PERSONALLY OR BY LETTER DEMANDS THAT A FARMER JOIN THE TRIPLE A PROGRAM AS A CONDITION OF DRAFT DEFERMENT OR FOR THE GRANTING OF A PRIORITY CERTIFICATE FOR ANY RATIONED COMMODITY.
TO PASS H.R. 4559, NAVY APPROPRIATIONS, 1945.

TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS H.R. 4115 WHICH GIVES HONORABLY DISCHARGED VETERANS, THEIR WIDOWS AND THE WIVES OF DISABLED VETERANS, WHO THEMSELVES ARE NOT QUALIFIED, PREFERENCE IN EMPLOYMENT WHERE FEDERAL FUNDS ARE DISBURSED.
TO PASS H.R. 4254, A BILL TO EXTEND THE LEND-LEASE ACT ACT OF 1941 FOR ONE YEAR.
TO PASS H.RES. 521, CREATING A SPECIAL COMMITTEE TO INVESTIGATE THE SEIZURE BY THE GOVERNMENT OF THE PROPERTY OF MONTGOMERY WARD CO., TO DETERMINE WHETHER OR NOT SUCH SEIZURE WAS AUTHORIZED BY LAW.
TO PASS H.R. 4646, SIMPLIFYING THE PREPARATION OF INDIVIDUAL INCOME TAX RETURNS.

TO PASS S. 1767, THE SERVICEMAN'S READJUSTMENT ACT OF 1944, A BILL WHICH DECLARES VETERANS ADMINISTRATION TO BE AN ESSENTIAL WAR AGENCY, FURTHER PROVIDES FOR VETERANS' HOSPITALIZATION AFTER WAR, AND ESTABLISHES PROCEDURES FOR WAR INJURY CLAIMS.
TO PASS H.R. 2539, A BILL WHICH PERMITS CONTAINERS OF DISTILLED SPIRITS IN BONDED WAREHOUSE TO BE COMBINED AND CONSOLIDATED, UNDER CERTAIN CONDITIONS.
TO PASS H.R. 1117, PROVIDING RETIREMENT PAY FOR CERTAIN CIVILIAN EMPLOYEES OF THE PANAMA CANAL.
TO PASS H.R. 4879, WAR AGENCIES APPROPRIATIONS BILL, 1945.

CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 4070, INDEPENDENT OFFICES APPROPRIATION BILL, TO RECEDE FROM DISAGREEMENT WITH A SENATE AMENDMENT WHICH REQUIRES AGENCIES WHICH HAVE EXISTED FOR MORE THAN A YEAR TO SUBMIT A BUDGET BEFORE THEY CAN RECEIVE FUNDS.  THE HOUSE CONCURS IN THE AMENDMENT WITH A FURTHER AMENDMENT MAKING CUT-OFF DATE JAN. 1, 1945.

TO AMEND H.R. 4937, FOREIGN ECONOMIC ADMINISTRATION APPROPRIATIONS, 1945, BY ADDING THE RESTRICTION THAT NONE OF THE FUNDS THEREIN APPROPRIATED SHALL BE MADE AVAILABLE TO ANY NATION WHOSE TROOPS HAVE NOT BEEN ENGAGED IN ACTUAL BATTLE PARTICIPATION IN THE PRESENT WAR.
TO PASS H.R. 4937, WHICH MAKES APPROPRIATIONS FOR DEFENSE AID (LEND-LEASE) FOR THE PARTICIPATION OF THE U.S. IN THE WORK OF THE U.N. RELIEF AND REHABILITATION ADMINISTRATION
TO RECOMMIT WITHOUT INSTRUCTIONS, H.RES. 283, A BILL EXTENDING THE TIME PERIOD FOR 1 YEAR, IN WHICH WAR CRIMES MAY BE PROSECUTED.
TO PASS H.J.RES. 283, A BILL EXTENDING FOR 1 YEAR, THE TIME IN WHICH WAR CRIMES MAY BE PROSECUTED.
CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 4204, DEPTS, OF STATE, JUSTICE AND COMMERCE APPROPRIATION BILL, 1945, TO RECEDE AND CONCUR IN A SENATE AMENDMENT WHICH PROVIDES FUNDS FOR A CENSUS OF AGRICULTURE.
CONFERENCE REPORT ON S.J.RES. 133, EXTENDING TIME LIMIT FOR PROSECUTION OF CERTAIN WAR CRIMES.
TO AGREE TO CONFERENCE REPORT ON S. 1767, SERVICEMEN'S READJUSTMENT ACT OF 1944.

TO AMEND H.R. 4941, EXTENSION OF THE EMERGENCY PRICE CONTROL ACT OF 1942 AND THE STABILIZATION ACT OF OCT. 2, 1942, BY PROVIDING THAT IN THE SETTING OF PARITY PRICES FOR CRUDE OIL, CONSIDERATION SHALL BE GIVEN TO THE NECESSITY OF EXPLORING FOR THE OIL.

TO AMEND H.R. 4941, EXTENSION OF THE EMERGENCY PRICE CONTROL ACT OF 1942 AND THE STABILIZATION ACT OF OCT. 2, 1942, BY MAKING CERTAIN CHANGES RELATING TO COURT PROCE- DURES IN THE EVENT OF COMPLAINT; TRIAL, AND REVIEW OF PROCEEDINGS UNDERTAKEN PURSUANT TO OR AGAINST THE REGULATIONS OF SAID ACT.
TO PASS H.R. 4967, MILITARY ESTABLISHMENT APPROPRIATION BILL, 1945.

CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 4414, LEGISLATIVE AND JUDICIARY APPROPRIATIONS, THAT THE HOUSE RECEDE AND CONCUR IN A SENATE AMENDMENT, WITH AN AMENDMENT INCREASING THE AMOUNT APPROPRIATED FOR CLERICAL PERSONNEL EMPLOYED BY THE JUDICIARY.
CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 4204, DEPTS OF STATE, JUSTICE AND COMMERCE APPROPRIATIONS, THAT THE HOUSE CONCUR IN A SENATE AMENDMENT PROVIDING FOR A CENSUS OF AGRICULTURE.
TO PASS S. 1718, A BILL TO ESTABLISH PROCEDURES FOR SETTLEMENT OF WAR CONTRACTS CLAIMS.

CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 4443, DEPT. OF AGRICULTURE APPROPRIATIONS, TO RECEDE AND CONCUR IN SENATE AMENDMENT, PROVIDING SALARY INCREASES FOR VETERNARIANS AND INSPECTORS IN THE BUREAU OF ANIMAL INDUSTRY AND THE MEAT INSPECTION SERVICE, RESPECTIVELY.
CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 4443, TO RECEDE AND CONCUR IN A SENATE AMENDMENT PROVIDING INCREASED APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE ERADICATION OF BARBERRY.
CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 4443, TO RECEDE AND CONCUR IN A SENATE AMENDMENT PROVIDING FOR THE CONTINUATION OF THE GUAYULE RUBBER PROJECT.

CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 4443, TO RECEDE AND CONCUR IN A SENATE AMENDMENT WHICH STRIKES OUT A PROHIBITION OF PARTISAN POLITICAL ACTIVITY ON THE PART OF AGRICULTURAL ADJUSTMENT ADMINISTRATION AGENTS, AND STRIKES OUT THE PROVISION DENYING SALARY TO AAA PERSONNEL WHO DEMAND PARTICIPATION IN AAA PROGRAMS AS A CONDITION FOR DRAFT DEFERMENT.
TO AGREE TO CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 4183, WAR DEPARTMENT CIVIL APPROPRIATIONS ACT.
TO STRIKE THE ENACTING CLAUSE OF H.R. 4219, APPROPRIATING FUNDS FOR TRAINING AND EMPLOYMENT OF FEMALE PILOTS IN THE ARMY AIR FORCE.

TO PASS H.RES. 422, AFFIRMING THE INTENT OF CONGRESS THAT THE REGULATION OF THE INSURANCE BUSINESS REMAINS IN STATE CONTROL AND THAT THE RELEVANT ACTS OF 1890 AND 1914 AS AMENDED BE NOT APPLICABLE TO THAT BUSINESS.
TO RECOMMIT H.RES. 422, AFFIRMING THE INTENT OF CONGRESS THAT REGULATION OF INSURANCE BUSINESS STAY UNDER STATE CONTROL.
TO PASS H.RES. 593, OPEN RULE FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 4901.

CONFERENCE REPORT ON S. 2051, WAR MOBILIZATION AND RE- CONVERSION ACT OF 1944, TO INSIST ON DISAGREEMENT WITH A SENATE AMENDMENT WHICH GRANTS TO EVERY CIVILIAN EMPLOYED IN ESSENTIAL WAR INDUSTRIES, $200 FOR TRANSPORTATION BACK HOME OR TO ANOTHER JOB.

CONFERENCE REPORT ON S. 2051, WAR MOBILIZATION AND RECONVERSION ACT OF 1944, TO INSIST ON DISAGREEMENT TO SENATE AMENDMENT PROVIDING THAT FEDERAL GOVERNMENT WILL PAY UNEMPLOYMENT COMPENSATION FOR FEDERALLY EMPLOYED WORKERS.
CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 5125, SURPLUS PROPERTY DISPOSAL ACT OF 1944.
TO PASS H.R. 4911, A BILL TO ESTABLISH FEDERAL CROP INSURANCE FOR WHEAT, COTTON AND FLAX.
TO PASS H.R. 5564, A BILL TO FREEZE SOCIAL SECURITY PAYROLL TAX AT 1%.
TO CONSIDER H.RES. 672, THE RULE FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 5590, CLERK-HIRE ALLOWANCE.
TO PASS, H.R. 5590, A BILL TO PROVIDE EACH MEMBER OF CONGRESS WITH $3000 PER YEAR TO PAY FOR OFFICE STAFF.

TO PASS H.R. 2211, A BILL TO ABOLISH THE JACKSON HOLE MONUMENT, AND RESTORE THE AREA THEREIN TO ITS STATUS AS PART OF THE TETON NATIONAL FOREST.  AFTER REPEATED REQUESTS THAT JACKSON HOLE BE CONSIDERED PART OF THE TETON NATIONAL PARK HAD BEEN REFUSED BY CONGRESS, PRESIDENT ROOSEVELT ACHIEVED THE GOAL BY PROCLAMATION, MAKING JACKSON HOLE A NATIONAL MONUMENT, AND, IN EFFECT, AN EXTEN- SION OF THE NATIONAL PARK.
CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 3429, A BILL TO PROVIDE THAT THE INTERIOR DEPARTMENT MAY HIRE RETIRED FORMER EMPLOYEES AS CONSULTANTS, BUT THESE MEN WILL NOT LOSE THEIR RETIREMENT BENEFITS.
CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 5587, FIRST SUPPLEMENTAL APPRO- PRIATION BILL, TO RECEDE AND CONCUR IN A SENATE AMENDMENT PROVIDING $5,000,000 TO HIRE ENUMERATIONS FOR THE CENSUS OF AGRICULTURE.
